CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 4,5 Although remarkable progress has been made in the design and synthesis of p - type polymer semiconductors , their performances in terms of hole mobilities and photovoltaic properties remain to be further optimized and maximized.

Let's think step by step.

1. p-type polymer semiconductors

These are the Material Names mentioned in the paragraph. They refer to a specific type of polymer material used as semiconductors, where the dominant charge carrier is a hole.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 4,5 Although remarkable progress has been made in the design and synthesis of p - type polymer semiconductors , their performances in terms of hole mobilities and photovoltaic properties remain to be further optimized and maximized.

Let's think step by step.

1. p-type polymer semiconductors
2. hole mobilities
3. photovoltaic properties.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. hole mobilities
2. photovoltaic properties
3. p-type polymer semiconductors (can be considered a material type, but specifically a type of semiconductor material).

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| hole mobilities |
| photovoltaic properties |
| p-type polymer semiconductors |

(Note: Since "p-type polymer semiconductors" can be considered a material type, it is included for completeness, but its properties are the focus of the paragraph, so it is also a valid entity.)

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 4,5 Although remarkable progress has been made in the design and synthesis of p - type polymer semiconductors , their performances in terms of hole mobilities and photovoltaic properties remain to be further optimized and maximized.

Let's think step by step.

1. p-type polymer semiconductors: This is a type of polymer material that can conduct electricity with holes as the charge carriers. It is the entity that is being discussed in the context of optimizing and maximizing their properties.
2. hole mobilities: This is a property of semiconductors that describes how easily charge carriers (holes in this case) can move through the material. It is one of the performances being referred to in the paragraph that needs to be optimized and maximized.
3. photovoltaic properties: This is another property of semiconductors that is being mentioned in the paragraph. Photovoltaic properties refer to the ability of a material to convert light energy into electrical energy. In the context of the paragraph, it is implied that the photovoltaic properties of p-type polymer semiconductors need to be optimized and maximized.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. hole mobilities (relevant to the value of the material property related to the ease of movement of charge carriers in the material)
2. photovoltaic properties (relevant to the material property related to the ability of the material to convert light energy into electrical energy)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| hole mobilities |
| photovoltaic properties |
